alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 2:02PM EST until February 05 at 6:24AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River near Dawsonville affecting Dawson and Forsyth Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Etowah River near Dawsonville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Moderate flooding begins in northwest Forsyth county. Old Federal Road begins to flood and Nicholson Road is closed off to residents. Minor flooding continues in south Dawson county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 14 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM EST Friday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
